wikipedia_page.main: Walter Scott (21 January 1886 – 1955) was an English professional football goalkeeper who played in the Football League for Grimsby Town, Sunderland and Everton. He notably became the first goalkeeper to save three penalties in a single match, for Grimsby Town versus Burnley in a Second Division fixture in 1909. He saved 14 of 17 penalties during the 1908–09 season.
